com.konakart.al

Class WishListMgr

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.konakart.al.BaseMgr
      • com.konakart.al.WishListMgr

  • public class WishListMgr
extends BaseMgr
    Contains methods to manage Wish Lists

      • fetchCustomersWishLists

        public void fetchCustomersWishLists()
                             throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                                    KKAppException
        Get the wish list for a customer and language and set them on the customer object of the customerMgr. Each wish list may have an array of wish list items, each of which has a fully populated product object.
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

                        throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                               KKAppException

      • addToWishList

        public int addToWishList(com.konakart.appif.WishListItemIf item)
                  throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                         KKAppException
        The WishListItem is added to one of the customer's wish lists. The chosen wish list is determined by the wishListId attribute of the WishListItem object.
        If the wishListId attribute of the wishListItem is set to a negative number, then it will automatically be added to the wish list of the current customer. If the current customer has more than one wish list, then an exception will be thrown. In this case the wish list id must be set correctly. If the current customer has no wish lists, then a wish list will automatically be created.
        The new wish list item will appear on the UI only after fetchCustomersWishLists() is called.
        Parameters:
        item -
        Returns:
        Returns the id of the new wish list item
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • deleteWishList

        public void deleteWishList(int wishListId)
                    throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                           KKAppException
        The wish list referenced by the wishListId parameter, and all of its items will be deleted. If wishListId is set to a negative number all of the current customer's wish lists will be deleted.
        The wish lists will disappear on the UI only after fetchCustomersWishLists() is called.
        Parameters:
        wishListId -
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • editWishList

        public void editWishList(com.konakart.appif.WishListIf wishList)
                  throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                         KKAppException
        The wish list passed in as a parameter will be edited.
        The edited wish list will only appear on the UI only after fetchCustomersWishLists() is called.
        Parameters:
        wishList -
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
                  throws KKAppException
        Based on a configuration variable decides whether wish lists are enabled. It returns true if they are enabled. Otherwise it returns false.
        Returns:
        Returns true if wish lists are enabled
        Throws:
        KKAppException

      • navigateCurrentWishLists

        public void navigateCurrentWishLists(java.lang.String navDir)
                              throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                                     KKAppException
        This method is called to navigate through a list of wish lists when the list is longer than maxRows.
        navDir can take the following values which are retrieved using getter methods on the WishListMgr instance:
        • getNavNext()
        • getNavBack()
        • getNavStart()
        Parameters:
        navDir - The navigation direction
        Throws:
        com.konakart.app.KKException
        KKAppException

      • navigateCurrentWishListItems

        public void navigateCurrentWishListItems(java.lang.String navDir)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called to navigate through a list of wish list items when the list is longer than maxItemRows.
        navDir can take the following values which are retrieved using getter methods on the WishListMgr instance:
        • getNavNext()
        • getNavBack()
        • getNavStart()
        Parameters:
        navDir - The navigation direction
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

                       throws com.konakart.app.KKException,
                              KKAppException

      • orderCurrentWishListItems

        public void orderCurrentWishListItems(java.lang.String orderBy)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is called to change the order of a list of wishlist items in the currentWishListItems array. The orderBy parameter can take a single value that can be retrieved from the WishListMgr using a getter methods:
        • getObPriority() - Order by gift priority
        Parameters:
        orderBy - The order by parameter
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNavBack

        public java.lang.String getNavBack()
        Static string - navigate backwards. It is the string required to pass to the navigateCurrentWishLists() or navigateCurrentWishListItems() as the navdir attribute when navigating backwards.
        Returns:
        Returns the navBack.

        Returns:

        Returns the navStart.
